text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Network connectivity>
We are investigating intermittent connectivity issues between the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and other AWS Regions.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Network connectivity>
We can confirm intermittent issues for Internet and Inter-region network connectivity within the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. We have mitigated the impact but continue to work towards full resolution.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Network connectivity>
Between 9:21 AM and 9:31 AM PDT and between 9:41 AM and 9:51 AM PDT we experienced Internet connectivity issues for the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and Inter-region connectivity issues between the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region and other AWS regions. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Errors>
We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Errors>
We continue to investigate increased error rates and latencies for the EC2 APIs and EC2 Management Console in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing EC2 instances are not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Launch Latencies>
We are investigating increased launch times for EC2 instances managed by Auto Scaling in the US-WEST-2 Region.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Error Rates>
We are investigating increased error rates for newly created functions in the US-WEST-2 Region. This includes functions created via the console as well as those created via the API or CLI.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Provisioning Latencies>
We are investigating increased provisioning times for load balancers in the US-WEST-2 Region. Connectivity to existing load balancers is not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Delays in starting clusters>
We are investigating delays in starting clusters in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing clusters are not affected.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Provisioning Error Rates>
We are investigating increased error rates and latencies for provisioning new WorkSpaces in the US-WEST-2 Region

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased API Errors>
We are seeing recovery for the increased error rates and latencies affecting the EC2 APIs in the US-WEST-2 Region. Some requests may return a "request limit exceeded" error as we work toward full recovery. We recommend retrying failed requests.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Provisioning Error Rates>
Between 1:00 PM and 3:00 PM PDT, we experienced increased error rates for new WorkSpaces provisioning in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing WorkSpaces were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
